title: Port DOOM to Kenix with musl libc
description: Port DOOM to Kenix microkernel using musl libc. Requires creating platform-specific files for video (framebuffer), system (timing), and stubs for sound/network.

title: Investigate and fix page alignment/size issues
description: There may be page alignment or size issues causing problems. Need to audit memory management code for proper alignment handling.
design:
Two bugs found:
1. CRITICAL: sys_brk() in syscall.rs:2565-2566 uses page NUMBER calculation instead of proper address-based tracking. Could cause heap to overwrite low memory.
2. MINOR: address_space.rs:682 uses hardcoded 4096 instead of PAGE_SIZE constant.

title: Create shared libvirtio crate to eliminate code duplication
description: virtio_mmio.rs and virtqueue.rs are duplicated across kbdev, fbdev, blkdev, and netdev (~320 lines each). Extract to shared user/libvirtio crate.
design: ~41KB duplicated across 4 servers (fbdev, kbdev, blkdev, netdev). Extract to user/libvirtio crate. Only device_id constants and one utility method (read_config_byte) differ. Should reduce to ~15KB (64% savings).

title: Test large file support
description: Verify that large files work correctly. May be related to page alignment issues.

title: Investigate random crashes
description: Random crashes reported. Need to identify patterns and root causes.
design:
## Investigation Complete

Analysis found several critical issues that could cause random crashes/hangs:

### Fixed Issues:
1. **Frame allocator bitmap bounds** (kernel/src/mm/frame.rs:252-275)
   - Added bounds checking to get_bit/set_bit functions
   - Prevents out-of-bounds access if memory > 1GB

2. **VirtIO spin loops converted to yield with timeout**
   - user/blkdev/src/blk.rs: Two spin loops in read/write operations
   - user/netdev/src/net.rs: TX completion spin loop  
   - user/fbdev/src/fwcfg.rs: DMA polling loop
   - user/fbdev/src/virtio_gpu.rs: Already fixed in previous session

### Verified Safe:
- TASKS array access in IPC code: is_valid_task() called before access
- sys_kill: Validates task ID bounds before TASKS access
- Frame free: Validates address within memory_start..memory_end

### Remaining Concerns (low priority):
- Static mut references in user-space (Rust 2024 warnings)
- Single-core only scheduler - no SMP safety yet
notes: Fixed frame allocator bounds and VirtIO spin loops. System tested and boots correctly.
